DataElement.preferredName: Hematology Blood Transfusion History Questionnaire Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof._The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof._The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Hematology; the branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Property.preferredName: Blood Transfusion Personal Medical History Questionnaire
Property.preferredDefinition: The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

Concepts.definition: The injection of whole blood or a blood component directly into the bloodstream.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
